title: 105_s887
content: The Act titled "National Underground Railroad Network to Freedom Act of 1997" is established for the purpose of recognizing and preserving the history of the Underground Railroad. The Underground Railroad was a significant expression of the American civil rights movement, bridging divides of race, religion, and nationality to uphold ideals of liberty and freedom. The Underground Railroad Advisory Committee conducted a study on appropriate means. The Underground Railroad Advisory Committee conducted a study and found that many important sites are in danger of being lost or destroyed, with high potential for preservation in 29 States, the District of Columbia, and the Virgin Islands. The Underground Railroad Advisory Committee found that preservation of important sites is crucial in 29 States, the District of Columbia, and the Virgin Islands. The National Park Service can play a vital role in facilitating the national commemoration of the Underground Railroad through partnerships with various levels of government and the private sector. The National Park Service aims to engage the American people through a unified and flexible program linking historic sites related to the Underground Railroad. The Act recognizes the importance of the Underground Railroad, the sacrifices of slaves seeking freedom, and those who helped them. It authorizes the National Park Service to coordinate and facilitate these efforts. The National Park Service is authorized to coordinate and facilitate activities commemorating the history of the Underground Railroad, its significance in the civil rights movement, and its relevance in promoting racial harmony and national reconciliation. The National Underground Railroad Network to Freedom Program is established under SEC. 3. The Secretary of the Interior will establish the National Underground Railroad Network to Freedom program within the National Park Service. The program will produce educational materials, enter into agreements for technical assistance, and create an official symbol for the National Network. The National Underground Railroad Network to Freedom program, established by the Secretary of the Interior, includes units or programs of the National Park Service related to the Underground Railroad, properties on the National Register of Historic Places with connections to the Underground Railroad, and educational facilities directly related to the Underground Railroad. Cooperative agreements and memoranda of understanding are utilized to achieve the Act's purposes and coordinate the Federal and non-Federal elements of the National Network with National Park Service units. The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements or memoranda of understanding with other entities, including Federal agencies, States, localities, and private entities, to carry out the National Underground Railroad Network to Freedom program. Authorization of appropriations is set at $500,000 for fiscal year 1998 and $1,000,000 for each subsequent fiscal year.
